text: DAVID AAMES, JR., 32, swings out of bed and sits on the corner of his mattress. it's a chilly New York City morning. Early sunlight glows around the corner's of his curtains.
open your eyes... He reaches behind him to shut off a slim voice-activated clock-radio. He rises, a comforter draped around his shoulders, and heads to the bathroom.

David regards himself in the mirror of a beautifully-tile and well-appointed bathroom. in his thirties now, his looks have only deepened and improved. He brushes his teeth. He spots a gray hair, and holding tweezers, seizes and plucks it.
David puts on a shirt. Checks his wallet for money. His bedroom is elegant and spare.
He slips down the stairs into the expansive living area o this deeply-textured apartment. A stunning, inherited boo collection lines the walls.

location: NEW YORK CITY GARAGE BELOW APARTMENT/STREETS -

text: David starts up his dark green sports car, and roars onto the New York City streets. 2 EXT. NEW YORK SIDE STREETS u- MORNING David travels the side-streets to work. He senses a growing weirdness. The streets are empty. He looks at. hi watch. It's        8:12.  He continues anxiously. Runs a light. Music rises.

The most recognized piece of real-estate in the world is silent. It is as if the world's biggest parade has just left, taking everybody with it. David pulls over haphazardly. He exits the car, leaving it in the middle o the street. He begins to walk, faster now, as music rises All the electricity is on. There is absolutely nobody in sight. David begins to run, searching for humanity. The billboards - electronic and still - all sell easy solutio to his loneliness. He pulls up short., stopping and cryin out in anguish. There is no one left in the world.
Open your eyes... open your eyes, David...
David hangs out of bed, his mouth in an open silent screa Covers his face with both hands.

. open your eyes... He reaches behind to shut off the same clock-radio, and i voice.  He makes a relieved agonized sound into the pillow. Gets up, sees a pizza box... a container of soup... a remote control on the floor. We hear an incisiv voice with a comforting lilt - a man we'll meet later.
Well, I suppose the empty street meant loneliness.
You're a shrink. You've got to do better than that.
I'm a doctor. Let's not stereotype each other. Not all rich kids are soul-less, and not all psychologists care about dreams. The question is how you 3 got here, and why you've been charged.
What do you want to know? I was about to turn 33. I ran three magazines, and a world-wide publishing house. On most days I actually fooled myself into believing it would last forever.
David checks himself in the mirror. Seizes and plucks tha same gray hair.
Isn't that what being young is about? Believing secretly that you would be the one person, in the history of man, who would live forever?

David enters, reaching for his wallet, repeating the morning ritual. A figure stirs in the bed behind him. She leans upward, wearing David's college basketball tank for pajama-top. She's warm and wicked, a mildly reformed part girl, the kind of girl first-novels are written about. Sh is JULIANNA GIANNI,25.
Where you going so early?
(slightly self-conscious) Hey, don't record any more messages on my alarm--clock, okay?
Why not?
I'll think we're married or something.
Don't you ever say that word. Or I'll never come over here and bring you chicken soup and fuck your brains out again. 4
(exiting, from other room) How's your cold?
Still there. How's yours?
I guess you took my mind off it. She pulls a pink pill-box purse from the nightstand, withdraws a multi-colored phone.
Reyna, it's Julianna. I missed my audition. (dramatic, like Bette Davis) I lost my head. Listen, I have to go. (whispers) I'm with David.

David in his steel-and-linoleum bachelor kitchen. Julie swings into view. Her blouse is unbuttoned two buttons too many, down to mid-chest. She gives him a kiss on the cheek and lingers. David grabs a racquetball bag, talks t the next. room.
Help yourself to whatever you want. Set the alarm, Maria will clean up. Lock up when you go. And... you are the greatest.
Bye "honey!"
Bye "honey!" I'll call you later.
When? When?
Soon! They have a comfortable, healthy, mutually satisfying, gloriously superficial relationship. 5

David is about to enter the green sports car, then thinks better of it. He fires up a knock-around beater car from his collection. He drives into the street which is, comfortingly, now full of people. We hear R.E.M.'s "All The Right Friends."
David drives the crowded streets.        It all seems mor poignant today. Life is good again.

David pulls up to a lower-end apartment, checks his watch Enter the hung-over BRIAN SHELBY,        30ish. In a worl acquaintances, Brian is a true friend.   He has all the qualities of Abe Lincoln and, much to his chagrin, the looks too. He hops in the car with racquetball bag.
Did you reserve the court?
Easy. I can't handle heavy conversation at this ungodly hour.
I'm sorry to do this early. I gotta be done by 10. Car phone rings. David checks Caller ID - it's his office He clicks on.
You're not going to make the 8:45, are you?
How did you find me?
David Aames, you have to check the colors of the letters for the new issue of Rise.
What are the colors?
Yellow-and-red... or the traditional white. 6
Let, me think about it.
David, please. Don't be late for the ten o'clock with the board.
Okay, but. don't tell anybody where I am I don't care if God calls. I'm very busy.
Can't you just get rid of that board?
The Seven Dwarves? No.
Those people drive you nuts.
And that was the desire of my father, who hired them.
(suspicious pause) You fucked Julie Gianni again, didn't you? David takes off driving.
I know someone was there when I called. You had that tone. (imitates nasal phone voice) Oh, no man, I've got a cold. I'm hanging in tonight.
(shaky defense) I had a cold. I was alone.
Fine. You can do whatever you want with your life -
Thanks. 7
-- but one day you'll know what love truly is. It's the sour and the sweet. And I know sour which allows me to appreciate the sweet.
Julie Gi.anni is a friend. Sometimes we sleep together. Brian howls in pain, like a hurt dog.
What --
My dream girl... Julie Gianni... is your... fuck buddy. Brian emits another pained howl. David reaches over to change the music.
What do you want to listen to?
Slow down, man.
What have we got here - Barcelona, Looper... Radiohead? Brian freezes at what he sees.

Look out! Look out! David turns and sees he's hurtling into the back of a car stopped just in front of him. Clenching he hits the brakes, narrowly avoiding a high-speech collision. And then... to his right... another car comes hurtling toward him... and stops within an inch of deadly impact. is an awful moment, as the second car blares on the horn. Traffic continues, but the lingering feeling of dread and confusion is still in the air.
Fuck!
(annoyed) We almost died. 8
I know. My own death was right there in front of me, and you know what happened? Your life flashed before my eyes.
How was it?
Almost worth dying for. Pedestrians continue walking around the honking tangled mass of the near-.accident.
David meets Peter Brown and RACHEL, his second assistant, at. the front of the well-appointed headquarters of Aames Publications. Aames hops out of car and heads into the building.
David Aames Jr. turns down the corridor of Rise Magazine, male youth-culture-style magazine. Rachel gives him daily tabloid reports, continues with the essentials.
The art department needs a decision on the colors. Yellow- and- red, or white? And the board is pissed you're late.

You changed your hair. David taps on the window of the art department, in panic over several cover mock-ups. He gives a presidential thumbs-up, moves on. They look at each other, trying to decipher if the thumbs-up was a decision.

Did he mean the yellow-and-red or the white? David passes a holdover from the old days, older Receptionist       (BEATRICE) who speaks uncomfortably an gruffly into a headset. She gives David a knowing look - late again.
They're all waiting for you. And David - opinions are expected. 9

Do you dream about the Board, David? The Seven Dwarves, as you call them? David walks into the office. Framed original photos from album covers co-mingle with a splash of cultured art and books. Seven very-interested and very-alert looking Older Executives wait.
Sneezy, Bashful, Sleepy, Happy, Doc, Dopey, and of course, Grumpy.
(skeptical) How was Aspen?
(playful, mock drama) Good. Now I want answers, and I want them now. (pause) How's it going? He gestures charmingly, easily, and bows with apology ove his lateness. All are happy to see him. Sort of.
They still look at me like I was still eleven years old.
David at          11, blithely skateboarding the hallways passes Beatrice, who turns to an editor.
He's going to inherit everything. He gets it all. if

The light from a small line of chicken-wired windows cuts through the blackness. In the shadows of this dank room, we hear his voice but we do not see him. It is the smaller, slightly muffled tone of David Aames. In the shadows, he wears a mask.

You're scared of your dreams, aren't you? 10 Portrait of CURTIS McCABE, 52.            Doctor of Psych prison division. He's far too wily to spend the currency of his brilliance just yet. It's too early in their relationship. He stands tall, leaning on a steel desk, polishing his glasses with end of his coat.
It's a nightmare either way.
Is that how do you explain what's happened to you?
What --
What happened to your face?
I'm not talking to you anymore.
And you don't want to show me your face.
No.
Do you know why you're here?
(sarcastic) The conversation, the coffee --

David - the part where we parry and joust, and get to know each other bit-by-bit... we're going to have to skip it. You've been charged with murder. In four weeks, a judge will determine your fate based on what I write. You will talk to me --

There is no murder! It didn't happen! I don't have to talk to anybody! A Contentious Prison Guard (AARON) swings his feet down a gets up from watching a 17-inch television on a stool. He exits into the bigger room to quiet down David Aames. 11 Slight push in to show the television show he is watching and we see a snippet of "To Kill A Mockingbird."
You want me to help -
Get the fuck away from me.
Take it easy, sunshine.
Get the fuck away from me.

Take it easy, Face. Your whole story is full of holes! With great power, McCabe advances on the guard. His presence, when he turns on the switches, is considerable. MCCABE. Stop! Please leave. Right now. I'll take responsibility.
(whispering, exiting) I'm gonna get you, Daddy's boy little freak.
My parents are dead, you fuck!
Enough! The Contentious Guard leaves.
Is it true?
(sing-song) Good cop... bad cop.
That you're a Daddy's boy?

(in darkness, by rote) Primer on David Aames, Senior. My father was not built for the 21st Century. He never ate at 12 McDonald's, not once, and never watched television. Yet his biggest magazine is still TV Digest. He and my mother threw the grandest parties of the literary world. He ballooned, jumped from planes, sought adventure... His autobiography is the manual for every cutthroat publisher in New York. It's called Defending the Kingdom.
I've read it. Page  127.           "David Junior was a delight as a child." Did I miss something here? Is that all he wrote about you?

I don't think he ever got over the fact that I was terrified of heights. And when he and my mother were run over by a drunken teenager on New Year's Eve, ten years ago... David Aames moves closer to the light. We see a strange bland expression of his mask, at first other--worldly... then more clearly.
he left the keys to the Kingdom to me...    51% control,   49% going to a group of seven board members who all thought they were first in line.
And you believe the Board, the Seven Dwarves, put you here to take control of your company.
What do you care?

We're just talking. And tonight's Wednesday night, and I go to Black Angus for dinner with my daughters on Wednesday nights, so I'll have to leave soon. You understand that our time is limited, don't you? 13
If I talk, you'll just think I'm crazy. McCabe gathers his things.
With all the respect I can offer a man wearing a latex mask and spouting conspiracy theories, David, trust me - you've crossed that bridge.
Fine. Enjoy your dinner. Somehow the lilt in McCabe's voice draws him closer.

There are five basic emotions in life. Tell me. what emotion gripped... him... before he entered that cell? Was it Guilt? Shadows. There is no answer, just a rustling and a growin sense of anticipation in the darkness.
Hate? Shame? Shadows. Still no answer.
Revenge... McCabe now shows the invisible skill with which he has brought his client to the precipice. And now, with one word, he invites David Aames to look over.
Love? In the darkness, a rustling and the slight turn of a head
I'm completely on the wrong track, aren't I?
From the darkened back room, David Aames appears with ice and re-enters his party.

Who needs ice? Aames moves swirls is more like it - through into his party, which is nicely underway. Upscale. Modern. Part literary crowd. Part fashion crowd.       He's great in a crowd. Surrounded by people, David Aames comes alive.
catching the attention of a model.        (LYNETTE)
David! Happy Birthday.
Jesus, you have the greatest taste in shoes I've ever seen. Bar none. Anywhere. A Woman Caterer in Whites    (EMMA) slips by with a knowi smile.
The old place sure looks more crowded with people in it.
Emma, do you know Lynette?

No, but I shudder to think what. we might have in common. David notices that Brian Shelby has arrived with a guest, Woman who struggles with a package and a very large coat. On first glance, she's just another girl. On second glance, she's a killer. He notes her oddly funny behavior She removes the coat to reveal a very simple natural beauty. She is SOFIA SERRANO, a 27 year-old city girl wit a barely containable life-force. Enter PETER BROWN, David's male assistant with surreptitious headset. He gestures to a stereo appliance set up in David's living room.

The Living Stereo system is online and looking great. it's an 15 amazing prototype. They'd love an article on it if you like it... David nods, still focused on Sofia. Suddenly, he finds he can't take his eyes off her.
and happy birthday, sir.
as David arrives to greet Brian and his guest.
Hey man. Happy birthday and all the usual shit people say to each other. How you doing?
Livin' the dream, baby. Livin' the dream. The two friends hug. David shares a quick glance with Brian's date, who still burdened with coat.
(to Sofia, as in 'meet the notorious...') Meet David Aames.
(can't help but flirt) And to what do I owe this pleasure, the pleasure of --
(playful) -- the pleasure of Sofia. Serrano.
We met today at the library, if you can believe that --
I'm sorry about my coat. It's too big for your closet.
- we were both pretending to be intellectuals.
No no, I think it's amazing. I love your coat. 16
I overdressed. I mean I underdressed.
I'll just continue like you're both actually listening to me.
(to David) Do you have another room to put it in?
(invisible, re: their chemistry) I have ceased to exist.
Well, Madison Square Garden is nearby, it might fit there.
(shoves David playfully, as in touche) Happy Birthday. Her upbeat physicality is intoxicating. Sofia hands David her present.
We picked it out together. Neither look at Brian. Brian takes a breath. He's been here before.
Thank you.
We picked it out together. We...
Welcome.
Stop flirting and open it.
Okay.
Let's get a drink. 17
Okay.
I'll leave this upstairs. David exits. They are left to consider his personal charisma.

head_text.subj: A HOLOGRAPHIC DISPLAY CONNECTED TO STEREO

text: An odd and disarmingly beautiful display of Coltrane performing "My Favorite Things" in David's living room. Sofia passes a hand through Coltrane's image, admires it.

David is approached by THOMAS TIPP, a Brit, and an Associate board-member at Aames Publications. Tipp is ten years older than David, and he is the rarest of birds. A sentimental lawyer. And at the moment he's a bit drunk.
Hey Tommy. David moves to address him so he can still track Sofia.

Hey.  Listen to me. Don't blow me off. I'm all packed, I'm going back to London and I understand. You put me up for that other attorney's job, so you didn't have to fire me. A classy move, and your father would have done the same ---
It's okay, Tommy --

I became incompetent. Is there anything more unbecoming than an aging mascot? I cared about your father. I lived and breathed for him. But these guys, the board, they think you're stupid.  A corporate hazard, a rogue. But the word "stupid" is what David heard loudest of all. Nearby, we see a Woman Partner          (one of the Seven taking a quick look at David. 18

But they're going to find a way to get you out. They're lined up for your office - David scans the room. Beneath the good cheer, he sees the other layer. Lying. Disloyalty. All part of the institution he enjoys forgetting exists. Each word bashes his soul.

-- your job. Your life. Your position. They are working day and night. to cheat you out of your 51% vote. And they are going to sell this tradition, this tradition of words, so they can eat at a better cafeteria. And what they don't know is this - (gestures grandly to books that surround them) - people will read again. David's gaze falls upon Sofia, who is looking directly at him. And for one blinding moment, something passes betwee them. She looks away. He feels saved.
(interrupting with finality) I got it.
They even have a nickname for you behind your back. David smiles faintly. Understandingly.   Tipp kisses him on the cheek, boldly and drunkenly. He feels like a hero to himself.
Citizen Dildo. David flinches, just a little.
Now you've got great instincts. But I say this with complete love. Claim your life... Learn to be an Asshole... Don't be         - 19
(extracting himself) Two's enough -
Don ' t be- (immediately) Okay. Forgive me. I still believe in this family. Even if it's only you. David continues tracking Sofia as he slips over to Peter Brown.

Get Tipp out of here, drive him home, and in the morning tell him he's re-hired with a 50% raise. Set up a meeting with the other attorneys. I'm going to be in early tomorrow -- (a look from Peter Brown) -- earlier than usual.
David enters, shuts the door and sets Sofia's present dow A party dress is on his bed.
Hello handsome. He turns to see Julie Gianni in the bathroom doorway, wrapped in a comforter.
I've come to wish you happy birthday.
I didn't invite you, Julie.
Yeah, that was a little weird -
But that's how it works with parties. You have to be invited.
I'm mad at you, you dick. We made love four times the other night. 20
Is that good?
Two is good. Three is very good. But four -
(fishing for a compliment) Four is pretty good?
No, four is... four is... just hold me.
Four is what?
Hold me, and then I'll leave, and you can go talk to that cute brunette.
Four is what?
I don't want to meet your fancy friends. I knew 'em all back when I was fancy too. He holds her. They talk in between friendly kisses.
Four is what? She pulls away, and talks plainly to him.
She looks like a moth, David.
A moth?

Sometimes I worry about one of these clever girls in a big silly coat who'll play you in just the right way, and I'll lose my friend. And there'll be no more chicken soup parties for you and me. 21 She kisses him again. David very gently, and skillfully resists. She gets the message.
When will you call me? And don't say soon. I hate it when you say "soon."
Sofia eyes a framed smashed guitar handsomely mounted in glass display case.
So this is what's become of rock and roll. A smashed guitar behind a glass case displayed on some rich guy's wall.
It was a gift, actually. She turns and sees it's David, engaging smile in place. She jumps slightly.
(apologetic) I like it. She turns and walks away, David following close behind.
Whoa, whoa, whoa.
- how did you get all this stuff, this apartment, this life - David is looking just over her shoulder. She turns to see an almost disturbingly large portrait of David Aames, Sr. She turns back.
I see.
How about if you help me? Unless I'm horning in here.
You are, but the food's good. 22
(playful, like a spy) See, I've got a little problem. I've got a stalker.
It doesn't. sound life-threatening. Someone passes, bumping her slightly, into him.
I need a cover. I need for you to pretend we're having a scintillating conversation. And you're wildly entertained. I know it's tough.
I'll improvise    -
She's right across the room and she's burning a hole in my back right now, isn't she?
Red dress, strappy shoes?
Yes_
(beat, jarred) -- wow, she's really staring at you.
Shit.
And she seems to be growing... less happy.
Hmm.
I think she's the saddest girl to ever hold a martini. Julie Gianni sits on the steps watching. The girl, and th dress, looked much happier in the bedroom. Julie rises an begins to move. 23
Brian holds a drink, attempts to crash a conversation between two models. His debonair act is shaky.
David and Sofia race up the stairs. Bad kids having fun.
You have another apartment?
Sort of a day office. Come on - They arrive at the door to a smaller upstairs apartment.
I'm not going in there.

Well I am. Goodnight. He enters and shuts the door. Frustrated, she stands for moment, listening to the music streaming from the downstairs apartment. We watch her private moment as she decides to leave him, turns, feels the emotional pull, dances back and knocks sharply three times.
I hear her coming.
Really?
No. David pulls her inside. Shuts the door behind them.
Julianna and Brian, both looking for David, discover each other.
Artwork on the walls. Sofia is drawn to a powerful Monet... and it is not a copy.
We're safe.      And I've got nothing to drink... 24
Who did these paintings?
This is Joni Mitchell. This one is Monet. And this one is done by me. (as a tour guide) It is a snowboard.
Well, two of them are geniuses. (laughs)
(off the Monet) It's the real thing. His paintbrush painted that vanilla sky. His canvas. It. was my mother's.
Julianna and Brian hold their private conversation by a piano. They are bonded, almost mesmerized by their mutual fascination for David.
David and Sofia laugh.
You know what I think? You're either a very good actress or you really do sort of like me.
I am an actress.
There's probably not too much you aren't great at.
Are you about to compliment, my phone voice?
It's pretty good, you know -
Oh, I'd only disappoint, you. See - I'm not. qualified. I can spell. 25
I'm surprised you're available.
I'm surprised you're surprised.
I can't keep this banter going.
Me neither. Beat. They drop the act. A powerful, awkward moment... an the door opens.
I caught you.
Brian! Come in here!
What's going on --
Your friends are fun and I'm drunk.
(cheerful) Julie Gianni is stalking me.
She looked dangerous.
Nobody stalks me. So I drink.
Well, we're out of drinks up here.
Here, finish my Jack and Coke. He messily tries to hand his drink to David, but spills i embarrassingly. All his cool is gone, and what's left are his friends covering for him, cleaning up.
These stupid glasses        -
No, it's the stupid guy holding it. 26
(embarrassed) Don't worry. I'll get. us all something. Jacks and Cokes? She exits, leaving the two friends.
I better hit it. I drank too much and I didn't fucking eat.
Don't be stupid. The party's just starting.
(moving away) For you it is.
You can't go. You're my guest of honor.
Fuck you, David. You're paying me to write my novel, so you own me.
I don't own you. You're brilliant, you're good-looking, you're handsome.
But why'd you have to hit on Sofia?
No one's hitting on Sofia.
Fine. Whatever you say.               I'm crazy, I'm blind.
No, you're not blind. You're just drinking Jack Daniels. And when you drink Jack, you start. in with that Frank Sinatra, "She Shot. Me Down," gimme a cigarette, King of Sad thing...
That. I do. Gimme a cigarette. 27
I'll find one.
But wait. You're rich and women love you and I'm from Ohio and I'm drunk. Can I tell you the truth?
Everyone does.
I dig her.        And I've never said this to you before, about any girl. But she could be... could be could be could be... the girl of my fuckin dreams.
You're not from Ohio.
I know.
But if she fucks tip our friendship - she can go to hell. I won't allow it!         We are bros.
I feel the same way.
(wishes he believed it) Sure you do. Brianprepares to leave, as Sofia returns with   drinks.
Where you going?
I am Frank. And Frank must go.
Huh?
I good you bid evening. Sofialooks at her watch, and the situation.
Hang on, I'll go with you. 28
Stay, baby.
I'll give you a lift home later.
No, I have to work tomorrow.

You're in great. hands. (beat, realizing it's over) I'm just humoring myself that my opinion matters. Brian looks at the two of them. Life is telling him, and he knows it's time to go. Portrait of a man who will not get what. he wants. David notes the poetry in his friend.

(leans in close to David) You will never know the exquisite pain of the guy who goes home alone. Because without. the bitter, baby, the sweet ain't as sweet. Have a good time. He exits like a champ, a glorious sad-sack, with a hand flourish.
The Sweet and Sour speech again.
Julie Gianni dances, her eyes closed, her hand around a strange man's neck.
They stand nervously out in front of her apartment. In th distance, rain.
A lot of people are scared of heights. It's not the heights that bother me, it's the impact that terrifies me. (off her look) I won't stay long. She laughs. It was never his decision to make. 29

She switches the light on in an artfully messy city girl apartment. A life is lived here, a bed on the back-room floor, a bag of trash on the counter, lamp is askew. She makes no attempt to clean it up. He soaks in the details, including some miniature dolls that occupy her kitchen an shelves.
Hey Paulo! A large goofy dog comes running at her, and then proceeds to slather David with love too.
I'm glad he protects you. This is a lethal canine.
(from other room) I love living here. And I refuse to clean up!
No problem.

I've got to work around the clock to keep this place. David eases the dog away as he examines the oddly exquisi dolls. He grabs a look at her in the other room. A bit of leg between boot and skirt.  As he admires the dolls:
So you're really a dancer, huh?
For     14     years.   But I don't dance like you dance. She laughs to herself, steals a look at him. Turns away.
Do you want something to drink?

Sure. David looks at her refrigerator. A note reads: Call Dad! An odd epiphany occurs as he sees the collage of photos 30 that represent a hard-working, hard-earned, committed and passionate life. Shot moves across the photos. A young girl living a young girl's hard-working and happy life. Group photos of co- workers. A few from a vacation. A whole new cast of characters, all committed, and they all look inviting to him. And one gloriously random photo of her in Cabo San Lucas, raising a toast with friends.
I like your life.
Well, it's mine and you can't have it. David examines a humorously embarrassing vacation photo o a sloshed Sofia, a guy's arm reaching for her breast. Dedication reads: To Sergio! Marry me!
I do not want to know the story behind this photo. Who's Sergio?
It's a nickname.
Your nickname is Sergio?
It's a long story, and we don't know each other.
So many secrets.
That's because I'm really an arms dealer.
I've never known an arms dealer.
You do now. What about you? What's your nickname? David freezes. And then decides what the hell - to tell the truth.
Citizen Dildo. 31
You're not staying over.
(still stung over nickname) Never run a company. Stay an artist. Stay an arms dealer.

Oh please. Somehow, I can't play the violin for you. (beat) Although. It must be hard controlling all those people's lives. Everyone at that party is connected to you for survival in some way, it seems. David looks at her, mentally assessing her level of guile
Ever been married?
No. Ever accept any of your 12,000 proposals?
(playful, self- deprecating) 12,008.No.
And you moved to New York. To dance and paint and act and deal arms.
Right. (going through CDs) Do you want to hear Jeff Buckley... or Vikki Carr?
Jeff Buckley... or Vikki Carr? Both - simultaneously. He continues looking. Flashes of the photos on her refrigerator.

Everyone said "don't go to New York." But I just think good 32 things will happen if you're a good person with a good attitude. Doncha think? He regards her.  He's a little restless, and a lot enchanted. Is she for real?
You think I'm naive. He decides she's for real. He turns back to the photos on her fridge.
No. I really don't.
I dug her completely. Somehow, I had found the last semi-guileless girl in New York City.
I have to get to sleep. Truthfully -- I'm also working mornings as a dental assistant.
(to himself) Boy, am I going to the wrong dentist.
And you didn't immediately want to sleep with her?
Well you know - I'm a pleasure delayer.
(interested in his romantic style) How does that work?

(toying with the shrink) Pleasure delaying... you don't know? You keep the relationship casual until the absolute breaking point.And then, one night, or afternoon, or morning... it could be months from now... oh, you know how it works - 33 His vision moves across the bright blue sky of one of Sofia's photos. A single crimson cloud.
David sits with the mask, facing McCabe. McCabe is hangin on every word.
- actually no I don't. I've been married for twenty-two years.
Ah, you've got dinner with your daughters.

David storms around the corner from Dearborn's office, yelling, raving.
I want to wake up! I want to wake up! Aaron grabs for him. David wrenches free.
David runs down the corridor and into the elevator, Aaron chasing after him.
It's a nightmare! The doors shut. Music rising.
David runs out of the elevator, into the empty lobby. Sho cranes up to reveal he is utterly alone, reminiscent of t much-earlier Times Square shot. 96
Tech Support!! Music stops. We hear the ding of the elevator.
Who turns and approaches the elevator, exiting frame.
David enters the elevator to see Edmund Ventura, calmly waiting.
David Aames. I think it's time we had a proper re-introduction. I'm Edmund Ventura from the oasis Project, formerly Life Extension --a L.E.
Tech support.
Yes, I'm your Tech Support. We first met      150   years ago.
Oh shit. You sold me the Lucid Dream. Ventura smiles.
Well, what the hell happened?
I tried to warn you in the bar. I told you to exercise control, that it all depended on your mind. All of this, everything is your creation. And we're now heading toward your true moment, of choice.
"True moment of choice?"
Yes.
When did the Lucid Dream begin? 97
Remember the day of the nightclub?
(trying to remember) Yes.
David is collapsed on the ground. His mask clutched in hi hand, passed out. Rhythmic score.
(with importance) That night, when Sofia left you and you fell asleep on the pavement, that was the moment you chose for the splice...
(remembers the word) The splice?
The mask has tumbled out of his hand.
Splice. The end of your "real" life and the beginning of L.E.'s Lucid Dream. A splice of many years which passed while you were frozen and dreaming.
A moody day dawns. David's mask is just outside the reach of his outstretched hand.

head_text.subj: ON DAVID PASSED OUT ON STREET

text: Sofia's hand reaches in, and awakens him. Everything is suddenly a little more vivid, a little more super-real.
Open your eyes. They walk away, down the street, into a beautiful Vanilla Sky. Sofia slips her arm around his shoulder, as we've seen earlier.

From the moment you woke up on that street, nothing was "real" in 98 a traditional sense. Your Lucid Dream is monitored by Life Extension, and a panel of experts who follow your every thought. Even at this moment.

The scene continues as David Aames rides the elevator. Th compartment now rises above the first seven floors to reveal they are traveling upwards in an exterior elevator Other skyscrapers pass by outside the window.
Forgive me. I'm blowing your mind. David looks down with dread.
I'm not a big fan of heights.
I know. (continuing) We erased what really happened from your memory.
(reaching to understand) ..erased?
Replaced by a better life under these beautiful Monet-like skies.
(recognizing pieces) My mother's favorite.
That's right.. A better life because you had Sofia.
walking down the center of the Village Street.
And you sculpted your Lucid Dream out of the iconography of your youth. 99
from the life and psyche of his youth. Mirrored in David' life in moments we've already seen.
An album cover that once moved you...
An album cover?

head_text.subj: ON BOB DYLAN AND SUZE ROTOLO

text: The cover of "Freewheelin' Bob Dylan." Same pose. Same street.
a movie you once saw late at night that showed you what a father could be like...
Atticus Finch sits at the breakfast table with his kids.

head_text.subj: ON CURTIS MCCABE AND DAVID AAMES IN UNIT

text: The exact pose as McCabe and David talk in one of their prison conversations.
or what love could be like...

head_text.subj: ON SOFIA LAUGHING AT TABLE OF FLORENTINE'S

text: Her head held high, laughing.
laughing in the same way, a moment from "Jules et Jim."
The compartment hurtles upwards, rising higher than the surrounding buildings.
This was a kind woman, an individual, more than your equal. Ventura nods wistfully. He fell in love with her a little too. 100
You barely knew her in real life, but. in your Lucid Dream, she was your savior.
trying to remember, feeling the flashes of truth in brief moments. And then a bracing, challenging realization that something went wrong.
What happened in my real life? Something happened. What did you erase?
Do you really want to know?
almost nauseous
Tell me everything.
Match push in on David rising to his feet. His disfigured face thunders with a massive migraine. The exact. shot we once saw as David and Sofia walked away together. This time, David is alone.
The morning after the nightclub, you woke up on that street, hung- over and along. You got up and walked away. You never saw Sofia again.
I didn't kill Sofia.
No.
He can't remember any of this. And then...
You battled your board, the Seven Dwarves, for control. In the end it was Thomas Tipp, your father's 101 friend, the one whose job you saved, who wrenched the company back in your control.
David exits the company elevator and returns to Aames Publications. Tipp is out in front of the employees and staffers who welcome him back.
(warmly) Tommy. (vague memories) But then... somebody died.
David sits in front of the computer in bad physical shape
You longed for Sofia. You shut yourself away for months. You were alone. You couldn't take the pain anymore. Headaches... you could barely function.
I found you on the Internet. I signed the contract with you. And then...
Aames takes pills, collapses. Music plays.
I remember... It comes back to him, powerfully.
Somebody died. It was me.
It's zipped up. 102
The plastic-wrapped body of David Aames is slipped into a tube, which is clamped shut. A Christmas tree in the background, as music continues.

And on a day in late December, you gave yourself to us. You're now in a suspended state. INT. DAVID'S APARTMENT a-- MEMORIAL - DAY Friends and family clog the old apartment. Shelby looks out into the hallway and sees an old acquaintance.
Your friend Brian Shelby threw a three-day memorial in your old home. He was a true friend.
Sofia ventures into David's apartment alone, taking in th environment and remembering the best moments of her brief encounter with David.
You were missed, David. She moves into close-up, and we see the wonder and the jo of a perfect love, nearly attained. She soaks in the beautiful, painful mystery of life.
It was Sofia who never fully recovered. It was she who somehow knew you best. And like you, she never forgot that one night where real, true love seemed possible.
David contemplates getting into the car with Julianna. He makes the choice that. will change this, and his next lif
Consequences, David. It's the little things.
Sofia exits the shot and we're left with an empty frame. 103
David turns from looking out the window of the elevator.
(tears in eyes) The little things. There's nothing bigger, is there?
David and Ventura exit the elevator onto the rooftop.
Your subconscious did create problems. Your dream turned into a nightmare. The glitch has been corrected.
So all I have to do is imagine something? If I wanted McCabe to come back, right now - McCabe comes flying out of the door.
David. Listen to me. These people are dangerous. We're in trouble. We need to get off this roof now.
Who turns from McCabe to Ventura. Ventura leads David away.
We're now on "pause". And you're about to return to your Lucid Dream...
"Pause"?

(continuing) .. with all of the upgrades. You won't remember any of this, nor be charged for the technical support. it is now your moment of choice. You can return to your Lucid Dream, and live a beautiful life 104 with Sofia, or whomever you wish... or you can choose the world out there. Ventura gestures to the city beyond, as they come to a halt.
The world out. there. And you can bring me back, just. like Benny the Dog.
The client is starting to understand.

Yes. Just like Benny the Dog. Your face and body can now be fixed, of course. But it's very different out there now. Your finances won't last long. Your panel of observers are waiting for you to choose. Ventura gestures into the camera. He begins walking backwards to the roof's ledge.

There are no guarantees. But remember, even in the future, the sweet is never as sweet without the sour. David sees that Brian Shelby has now joined McCabe on the roof. He nods to Brian, who nods back.
How do I wake up?
The decision is yours. Ventura glances over the edge.
And I chose this scenario, didn't
(enjoying that he understands) Yes, to face your last remaining fear of heights.
David, don't listen to him. You were right. This is the Seven Dwarves. It's a set up! You can't trust him. David looks at McCabe with compassion.
Don't feel bad, David. This winning man is your creation. It's in his nature to fight for his existence. But he's not real.
who looks on with compassion. McCabe fights for himself.
I'm real. I have two daughters. You know that.
What are their names?
who feels for McCabe as the apparition crumbles.

Mortality as home entertainment. This cannot be the future. Can it? David regards McCabe. Once dynamic, McCabe now seems unsure of his own existence. Slowly, always looking at David, he settles into the truth of his very being. With great nobility, McCabe shoves his hands into his pockets and faces his own destiny... or lack thereof.
(quietly) Goodbye. 106
It's been a brilliant journey of self-awakening, and you've simply got to ask yourself -- what is happiness to you?
His moment of realization.
I want to live a real life. I don't want to dream any longer.
Any last wishes?
Let them out there read my mind.
I wish you well, David. Music rises as he turns to see Sofia. He moves to her. She touches his cheek. His face is restored. They embrace.
Look at us. I'm frozen, and you're dead. And I love you.
It's a problem.
I lost you when I got in that car. I'm sorry. She looks at him, beguiling and understanding.
But remember what you told me once? Every passing minute is another chance to turn it all around. She kisses him.
I'll find you again. She regards her lost love, taking him in. David treasures his last moments with her. 107 David takes a breath and begins backing to the ledge.

I'll see you in another life when we are both cats. David backs up and begins to run. He arrives at the edge, looking down at the distance to the ground, stopping himself at the precipice. He looks back to Sofia one last time, and then leaps out into the celestial future. For a fraction of a moment, he is suspended in mid-air. And he hurtles to the ground. And the ground hurtles to meet him.

It is the little things, the random poetic instances of David Aames' life that come back to him. Music rises as h realizes, finally, his own true poetry and humanity. The images topple onto each other with the rhythm of his heartbeat. Father. Mother. A casual glance of a stranger. All combine to give his life meaning. And then, finally, we see the face of the one person who gave him purpose in this life... and the next. Sofia.
The sound of a breath. A gulp of life. Someone's heart is beating.
Relax... relax, David... open your eyes... An eye opens and the pupil darts to the right and left. Life again.
open your eyes.
